description: Reconfiguration of the existing two self-contained residential units to create three self-contained flat (1 x 1 bed, 1 x 2 bed & 1 x 3 bed); basement excavation to the side and rear; three storey side extensions; single storey rear extension to lower ground floor level; incorporating additional rooflights, cycle storage, external amenity space and roof terrace at second floor level with associated minor internal and extenal alterations to include installations of new windows and doors
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).
| The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans:

L(-1) 101 (Site Plan) dated 06.2015, L (-2) 101 (Existing Lower Ground Floor Plan) dated 12.05.2009,  L(-2) 102 (Existing Ground Floor Plan) dated 12.05.2009, L(-2) 103 (Existing First Floor Plan) dated 12.05.2009, L(-2) 104 (Existing Second Floor Plan) dated 12.05.2009, L(-2) 105 (Existing Roof Plan) dated 12.05.2009, L(-3) 101 (Existing Section AA & BB) dated 12.05.2009, L(-3) 102 (Existing CC) dated 12.05.2009, L(-4) 101(Existing Front and Rear Elevations) dated 12.05.2009, L(-4) 102 (Existing Side Elevations) dated 12.05.2009,L (-1) 101 (Location Plan) dated 06.2015,  L(-2) 325 (Proposed Lower Ground Floor Plan) dated 09.2017, L(-2) 326 (Proposed Upper Ground Floor Plan) dated 09.2017, L(-2) 327 (Proposed First Floor) dated 09.2017, L(-2) 328 (Proposed Second Floor Plan) dated 09.2017, L(-2) 329 (Proposed Roof Plan) dated 09.2017, L(-2) 330 (Proposed Site Plan) dated 09.2017, L (-4) 324 (Proposed Section AA) dated 09.2017, L(-3) 325 (Proposed Section BB) dated 09.2017, L(-4) 323 (Proposed Front Elevation) dated 09.2017, L(-4) 324 (Proposed Rear Elevation) dated 09.2017, L (-3) 326 (Proposed Section BB- View from Street) dated 09.2017, L(-4) 325 (Proposed Side Elevations) dated 09.2017.
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning.
| Refuse and Recycling Provision

The development hereby approved shall not be occupied until refuse and recycling storage, in accordance with the Local Planning Authority Standards, has been fully implemented and made available for use. These facilities shall thereafter be retained for use at all times.

Reason: To ensure the provision of satisfactory facilities for the storage of refuse and recycling material, in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Adopted Development (Core) Strategy, policy 7B of the Adopted Ealing Management Development Plan Document (2013) and policies 7.4, and 7.6 of the London Plan 2016.
| Retention of Lion Statue
Notwithstanding condition 2, the Lion Statue located on the party wall between 57 and 57A shall be retained throughout construction and thereafter for the life of the dwelling.
| Obscure Glazing

Obscure glazing privacy screens on the first floor roof terrace shall be provided to prevent direct viewing toward the residential dwellings to the rear in accordance with L(-4) 323 REV A (Proposed Front Elevation) dated 24.11.2017, L(-4) 324 REV A (Proposed Rear Elevations) dated 24.11.2017, L(-4) 325 REV A (Proposed Side Elevations) dated 24.11.2017, L(-4) 324 REV A (Proposed Section AA) dated 24.11.2017, L(-3) 325 REV A (Proposed Section BB) dated 24.11.2017, L(-3) 326 REV A (Proposed Section BB) dated 24.11.2017, L(-3) 327 REV A (Proposed First Floor Plan) dated 23.11.2017.

Reason:  To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area in accordance with policies 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan (2015) and policy 7.4 of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan 2013.
| Transport and/or industrial noise sources

Prior to commencement of the development, a noise assessment shall be submitted to the Council for approval of external noise levels from transport and industrial/ commercial sources and details of the sound insulation of the building envelope including glazing specifications and of acoustically attenuated mechanical ventilation and cooling as necessary (with air intake from the cleanest aspect of the building) to achieve internal room- and (if provided) external amenity noise standards in accordance with the criteria of BS8233:2014. Approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.
| Separation of noise sensitive rooms in neighbouring flats

Prior to commencement of the development, details shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Council, of an enhanced sound insulation value DnT,w [and L'nT,w] of at least 5dB above the Building Regulations value, for the floor/ceiling/wall structures separating different types of rooms/ uses in adjoining dwellings, namely bedroom stacked above living/room and kitchen of separate dwelling. Approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: In the interests of the internal environment of the development and living conditions of occupiers of nearby properties and future occupiers of the site, in accordance with Interim Supplementary Planning Guidance 10, policy 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy 7.15 of the London Plan (2015), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012).
| External noise from machinery, extract/ ventilation ducting, mechanical gates

Prior to commencement of the development, details shall be submitted to the Council for approval, of the external sound level emitted from plant/ machinery/ equipment and mitigation measures as appropriate. The measures shall ensure that the external sound level LAeq emitted from plant, machinery/ equipment will be lower than the lowest existing background sound level LA90 by at least 5dBA in order to prevent any adverse impact on noise sensitive receivers in the surrounding area. The assessment shall be made in accordance with BS4142:2014 at the nearest and/or most affected noise sensitive premises, with all machinery operating together at maximum capacity. Details of any noise mitigation measures shall be submitted for approval. Approved details shall be implemented prior to use of plant/ machinery/ equipment and thereafter be permanently retained.
| Bicycle Parks

The provision for bicycle storage in accordance with adopted standards shall be provided in accordance with the approved plans and shall be continuously available and retained for the life of the development hereby approved.
Reason: To provide adequate bicycle storage to align with Sustainable Transport SPG and policy 6.9 and 6.13 of the London Plan 2016.
| Use of the Basement

The basement accommodation hereby permitted shall only be used for domestic purposes incidental to the enjoyment of the dwelling and not for any other use (including industrial, commercial or business use).

Reason: To ensure that the use of the basement does not, by reason of any other activity, harm the living conditions in the area, in accordance with policies 7.4 and 7.6 of The London Plan (2015), polices 7.4, 7A & 7B of the Adopted Ealing Development Management Plan Document (2013) and polices 1.1 (e)(g), 1.2 (f), 2.1(c) and 2.10 Adopted Development (Core) Strategy 2012.
